message.content:
cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.HC. 

The paper focuses on the problem of enabling autonomous robots to reason about spatial relations in human-centered environments, which is a core problem in robotics (cs.RO). The approach proposed in the paper involves using distance metric learning to enable the robot to generalize spatial relations to new objects, which is a common problem in machine learning (cs.AI). The paper also involves using real-world data to evaluate the effectiveness of the proposed method, which is a common practice in computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG). Finally, the paper emphasizes the importance of enabling robots to interact with non-expert users, which is a key aspect of human-computer interaction (cs.HC).
